data.title: Love, Love, Love
data.text: My husband and I love Spice! We always enjoy the food that we order here. The servers are kind and prompt. Spice has a gluten free menu for those who must avoid wheat or gluten. There are a nice variety of options on both the regular and gluten free menus. They also serve alcohol, appetizers, and dessert. The fried rice is a favorite of mine and the pad thai is my husbands go to meal.

data.title: Did not like it (not authentic thai food)
data.text:
I visited this restaurant with my friends in November, 2012 as one of our friend had been there before and liked the food. 
Thai food is my favorite and I have tried Thai food in US, Singapore and Thailand. 

By far, it is the worst Thai food experience I ever had. Food does not even remotely close to authentic Thai food. There are much better thai restaurants in Ames, IA.

data.title: Great Food...Friendly involved Owners
data.text: We picked this restaurant because we are both vegetarian and I'm gluten free.  When we went in, the owner himself came to our table and discussed our needs and personally recommended some options, and then went to the kitchen and told the cooks how to prepare it.  It was a fabulous meal, delicious and nutritional.

data.title: New-Found Favorite
data.text: We went to The Spice at the prime dinner hour (6:00) and were able to be seated right away.  The atmosphere was quite nice and the staff were extremely helpful, especially as it was our first time eating there.  They offer both a vegetarian and a gluten-free menu and all of the food is prepared to order so it is very easy to accommodate dietary restrictions or just picky eaters.  The food came out to us very quickly and was delicious, and we even got to choose our own spice level.  My meal (including tax) was under $15 so it is very well priced for the quality of food that you get.  We will definitely be returning to The Spice.

data.title: Buffet atmosphere in a sit-down restaurant
data.text: Tried this restaurant about 8 years ago and was not impressed. Gave it another try and was not impressed. The staff was friendly but seemed distracted.  The appetizer was highly recommended by our server, but meh.  My husband's beer was warm, my wine glass was removed before empty and never saw a refill on our water.  I ordered the Pad Ka prow-beef and it was very greasy and looked and tasted like dinty beef stew.  My husband ordered the Greene Curry and I think she brought him the wrong dish because neither of us have seen curry like that!  We will not be back and I would not recommend to anyone.  Unless you play Pokemon Go, because you can reach three Pokestops while inside the restaurant...and that was the highlight of the evening.

data.title: Addictive
data.text: If you like Thai food, you will love The Spice.  The food is consistently delicious and I, for one,  am absolutely addicted to the Pad Ka Prow with chicken while my best friend loves the Pad Thai.  The atmosphere is comfortable and the wait staff is friendly.

data.title: Spice it up
data.text: We use to live in Ames and love this place then. We also try to make it back once a year when we are there. Usually during football season when we are there a lot.

data.title: by far the worse thai food i ever had
data.text: If anyone likes thier thai food then you have no idea what thai food is suppose to taste like. the fried rice was something i never seen in my 15 years of living in thaland.  I also had the thai soup, what a mistake that was. I came to ames to visit family but i be happy to return home to thailand.

data.title: Great Evening
data.text: My husband and I enjoyed our dinner at this restaurant.  The atmosphere was lovely and the food delicious and reasonably priced.  We were traveling through and wanted Thai food.  We will certainly return here again when in the area.

data.title: Mixed reviews -
data.text:
I like the place. Nice upscale place in town. But I feel the curries are fresh one day & other days its not even worth paying $2. So this is what happened, I went on a dinner date & food was finger licking good. & the girl got impressed & I got lucky  but next time I got watery yellow curry hardly any flavor meat under cooked it was thick & I had to chew chew & chew.  Its always mixed feeling. I guess depends on if the chef is happy.
I have tried their yellow curry (Only once it was good) Pananag curry Too thick portion is 8-12 pieces of chicken and that too not huge. The only best part is their desert GREEN TEA ice cream. Awesommmme 

data.title: Amazing taste and that is about it........
data.text: I ordered the Drunken Pasta with shrimp.  I will state that is was delish!! Amazing flavors and I devoured it.  I drank a Shanty along side of it, perfection.  I will be back to try different dishes because there was many choices on the menu that look delightful.  The service was just ok.  There weren't many people in at lunch time and I thought she left us to fend for ourselves a few times, it wasn't horrible but it wasn't incredible.  She was friendly and helpful when she was there.  The ambiance wasn't anything spectacular either.  Rickety chairs and just kinda blah, this is why the 3 out of 5.  If service and atmosphere had been better I would have given a 4.

data.title: Best Thai food in town
data.text: Granted, there are only two Thai places in town. The Spice is the more upscale of the two, and while it is a little lacking in atmosphere, it's still very nice. The wine list leaves something to be desired and there is not a full bar, but the food more than makes up for it. Favorites include the Thai fried rice, dumplings, and the drunken pasta. Be sure to ask for things Thai spicy if you want some kick!

data.title: Decent Thai Food
data.text: They are not as good (or as cheap) as they used to be, but it is the best "fine dining" asian food place in town. Somewhere that has clean tables and good food. Great classic thai dishes!

data.title: Ho Hum
data.text: The fresh rolls with sweet cucumber sauce were just OK.  The sauce tasted more like mayonnaise than cucumber.  The chicken coconut soup had none of the flavors that one seeks.  Absent were the fish sauce, peppers, lime leaves and that woody ginger.  The coconut milk hadn't even acquired the flavor of the chicken as if the recipe had just coconut milk warmed to which chicken and mushrooms were added just before serving.  The entree's were less seasoned than one might have hoped.  When one goes to a Thai restaurant it is for the flavors that are unobtainable at home and most of these were missing.

data.title: New Green Curry Fan
data.text: Spice is home to an amazing collection of Thai food.  The green curry recommended by our waiter was excellent. . . Spicy, yet with a clean fresh taste. My husband was pleased with the less spicy, yet delicious fried rice. If you like Southeast Asian cuisine try Spice when in Ames

data.title: Always a fantastic experience
data.text: We go to the Spice regularly and the food is always delicious and fresh. It is impossible to make a wrong choice there. Our favorite dishes are the Pad Thai and the Lemongrass Chicken. They also have a great collection of teas and the staff is always friendly and helpful.

data.title: Excellent Red Curry
data.text: Was in town on business and requested Thai.  My host took me to this place.  Service was good and the food excellent.  I had the red curry with chicken off their lunch menu.  The flavors were really nice, and spicy!  Couldn't have been more pleased.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: The food is delicious and the price is really fair for the excellent quality, The wait staff have always been knowledgeable and helpful and the food comes out in a relaxed but responsive time.

data.title: The Best of Thai in Ames
data.text: I have been there multiple times. Perhaps one of my favorite food destinations in Ames. Ambience is wonderful. Good place for a romantic couple or a get together of a few friends. Might seem to be a bit costly but the food is awsome. My favorite has been a chicken dish that comes with a splendid combination of black pepper and cilantro. I like to go for Thai Spicy... Its an equivalent of about 12 spice level as compared to other restaurants around.

data.title: Gluten Free options are great!!
data.text:
My son and I are Celiac and the staff and cooks here are very knowledgeable and do a great job for us.  

The food is delicious and we have never had a bad experience.  Tremendous options and very flavorful.  

Highly recommended!!
